byline.contributor: Keith Bradsher and Hilda Wang contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

abstract: Chinese carmakers Zhejiang Youngman Lotus Automobile and Pang Da Automobile Trade agree to pay 100 million euros, or $140 million, for Saab Automobile, just before it faced court action.
snippet: Zhejiang Youngman Lotus Automobile and Pang Da Automobile Trade agreed to pay €100 million, or $140 million, just before the struggling Swedish automaker faced court action.
lead_paragraph: Zhejiang Youngman Lotus Automobile and Pang Da Automobile Trade agreed to pay €100 million, or $140 million, just before the struggling Swedish automaker faced court action.

headline.main: Saab Sputters On, Saved by 2 Chinese Automakers
headline.print_headline: Saab Sputters On, Saved By 2 Chinese Automakers
headline.seo: Saab Lives On, Saved by Chinese Investors
